result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven E Mick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:23pm.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Steven E Mick in court with attorney Jordan Lippert.  Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea questionnaire and rights form submitted.  Constitutional rights given.  Maximum penalties and elements recited.
Count #2, #3 and #4 - Guilty  plea entered by the Def.   Factual basis stipulated.  Victim compliance verified.  Court accepts the plea and Finds the Def. guilty and Orders that Judgment of Conviction be entered.

The State moves to read-in and dismiss Count #1; so ordered by the Court. 
The State moves to read-in an uncharged read-in of Violation of a TRO, from 8/21/15 (DA case #2015JE1948); so ordered by the Court. 
Recommendations presented by counsel.
Statement presented by the defendant. 
Written statement of the victim read by Atty. Lippert. 
Count #2 - 9 months jail IMPOSED AND STAYED.  The Court places the Defendant on probation for 18 months, concurrent. 
Count #3 and Count #4 - The Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on probation for 18 months, on each count concurrent. The defendant has credit for 3 days time served. 
Conditions:
-  $243 per count. (Bond posted to be applied.)
-  $200 DNA surcharge per count. 
-  $100 domestic abuse surcharge per count. 
-  Batterer's treatment or intervention programming specific to domestic related issues. 
-  Any other assessment, treatment or counseling per the Agent. 
-  No contact with Amy Miller unless contact is authorized by the Agent. 
-  No possession of any dangerous weapon or ammunition. 
-  No acts or threats of violence. 

Upon request of the defense, the Court extends the time to report to Probation to tomorrow.  
Recess 2:04pm.
Sent to Defendant (1)NOH for 10/23/15 Motion Hearing; hearing date past, def. did appear//sent to LKA; address updated on 10/21/15
Sent to Defendant (1)NOH for 10/16/15 Motion Hearing//sent to LKA(Def. updated address on 10/21/15

Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination; not signed by the Court

Case called at 1:44pm. [mo] 
Defendant Steven E Mick appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty Svehlek indicates that Mr. Mick is eligible for PD representation 
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are NOT waived by the Defense 

The Court requires a $500 CASH bond, with conditions:
--No Contact with Amy Miller
--If incarcerated Mr. Mick is to not have contact with Amy Miller or intimidate Amy Miller under section 940.07
--No presence at Marquardt Manor in Watertown
--No presence at Johnson Creek Outlet mall
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession of dangerous weapons as defined by statute

recess 1:52  pm. 


NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 8/31/2015 at 8:30am (time limits apply)
